docs.title: Hydro Lite
docs.text:
A compact control board for automated hydroponic systems. It drives eight 12 V nutrient-dosing pumps plus one 12 V master pump, letting you pre-mix before filling the reservoir. No soldering is required—boards arrive fully assembled and electrically tested (sold on Amazon).

!!! tip "Quick links" * Schematic PDF * Buy pre-assembled on Amazon (coming soon)

docs.title: Features
docs.text: MCU ATtiny1624 @ 16 MHz (Optiboot) Pump outputs 9 × N-MOSFET (8 nutrient, 1 master) @ 12 V / 5 A each Supply 9 – 15 V DC barrel jack Sensor bus 3-pin JST-PH I²C (3 .3 V logic)

docs.title: Schematic
docs.text: (Click the image for the full-resolution PDF.)

docs.title: Jumper Settings – I²C Pull-ups
docs.text:
!!! note "H1 / H2 pull-up jumpers" * Purpose: adds 4 .7 kΩ pull-ups to SDA and SCL. * Use when: * A sensor board lacks pull-ups, or * Cable length > 1 m. * Extra pull-ups sit in parallel with existing ones—safe for mixed devices.

Jumper Default Closed H1 (SDA) open adds 4 .7 kΩ pull-up H2 (SCL) open adds 4 .7 kΩ pull-up

Download the full CSV: hardware/hydro-lite/bom.csv

docs.title: Assembly & Test
docs.text:
Boards purchased on Amazon are pre-assembled and tested. For DIY assembly:

  1. Solder MCU, regulator, and passives.
  2. Apply 9 V; verify 3 .3 V rail.
  3. Flash Optiboot via the UPDI header.
  4. Run blink-pump.py to toggle each MOSFET and confirm outputs.
